001package io.cyborgcode.roa.api.client;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.roa.api.log.LogApi;
004import io.restassured.http.Method;
005import io.restassured.path.json.JsonPath;
006import io.restassured.response.Response;
007import io.restassured.specification.FilterableRequestSpecification;
008import io.restassured.specification.RequestSpecification;
009import java.util.Map;
010import java.util.Optional;
011import java.util.function.Function;
012import lombok.NoArgsConstructor;
013import org.springframework.stereotype.Component;
014
015import static io.cyborgcode.roa.api.config.ApiConfigHolder.getApiConfig;
016import static io.cyborgcode.roa.api.log.LogApi.extended;
017import static io.cyborgcode.roa.api.log.LogApi.step;
018
019/**
020 * Implementation of {@code RestClient} for executing REST API requests.
021 *
022 * <p>This class provides an abstraction for sending HTTP requests using RestAssured,
023 * logging request/response details, and handling execution logic.
024 *
025 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
026 */
027@Component
028@NoArgsConstructor
029public class RestClientImpl implements RestClient {
030
031   private static final long SLOW_REQUEST_THRESHOLD_MS = 2000;
032   private static final String LOG_TEMPLATE_RESPONSE_BODY = "Response body: {}.";
033
034   /**
035    * This configuration provides settings for API request execution, including logging behavior,
036    * response body truncation, and other configurable options.
037    */
038   private static final Map<Method, Function<RequestSpecification, Response>> METHOD_EXECUTORS = Map.of(
039         Method.GET, RequestSpecification::get,
040         Method.POST, RequestSpecification::post,
041         Method.PUT, RequestSpecification::put,
042         Method.DELETE, RequestSpecification::delete,
043         Method.PATCH, RequestSpecification::patch,
044         Method.HEAD, RequestSpecification::head
045   );
046
047   /**
048    * Hook for measuring time‚Äîoverride in tests to simulate slow calls.
049    */
050   protected long currentTimeNanos() {
051      return System.nanoTime();
052   }
053
054   /**
055    * Executes an API request with the specified request specification and HTTP method.
056    *
057    * <p>This method logs the request details, sends the request, logs the response,
058    * and returns the response.
059    *
060    * @param spec   The {@code RequestSpecification} containing request details.
061    * @param method The HTTP method to use for the request.
062    * @return The {@code Response} received from the server.
063    * @throws IllegalArgumentException If the request specification is not a {@code FilterableRequestSpecification}
064    *                                  or if the HTTP method is not supported.
065    */
066   @Override
067   public Response execute(final RequestSpecification spec, final Method method) {
068      if (method == null) {
069         throw new IllegalArgumentException("HTTP method must not be null");
070      }
071
072      if (!(spec instanceof FilterableRequestSpecification filterableSpec)) {
073         throw new IllegalArgumentException("RequestSpecification is not of type FilterableRequestSpecification");
074      }
075
076      String url = filterableSpec.getURI();
077      String methodName = method.name();
078
079      String rawRequestBody = Optional.ofNullable(filterableSpec.getBody()).map(Object::toString).orElse(null);
080      String prettyRequestBody = tryPrettyPrintJson(rawRequestBody);
081
082      String requestHeaders = Optional.ofNullable(filterableSpec.getHeaders())
083            .map(Object::toString)
084            .orElse("");
085
086      printRequest(methodName, url, prettyRequestBody, requestHeaders);
087
088      long startTime = currentTimeNanos();
089
090      Response response = Optional.ofNullable(METHOD_EXECUTORS.get(method))
091            .orElseThrow(() -> new IllegalArgumentException("HTTP method " + method + " is not supported"))
092            .apply(spec);
093
094      long duration = (currentTimeNanos() - startTime) / 1_000_000;
095      printResponse(methodName, url, response, duration);
096
097      if (duration > SLOW_REQUEST_THRESHOLD_MS) {
098         LogApi.warn("Request to endpoint {}-{} took too long: {}ms.", methodName, url, duration);
099      }
100
101      return response;
102   }
103
104
105   /**
106    * Logs the request details before execution.
107    *
108    * @param methodName The HTTP method used for the request.
109    * @param finalUrl   The full request URL.
110    * @param body       The request body (if applicable).
111    * @param headers    The request headers.
112    */
113   protected void printRequest(final String methodName, final String finalUrl, String body, String headers) {
114      step("Sending request to endpoint {}-{}.", methodName, finalUrl);
115      extended("Request body: {}.", body != null ? body : "");
116      extended("Request headers: {}.", headers != null ? headers : "");
117   }
118
119   /**
120    * Logs the response details after execution.
121    *
122    * @param methodName The HTTP method used for the request.
123    * @param finalUrl   The full request URL.
124    * @param response   The response received from the server.
125    * @param duration   The duration of the request execution in milliseconds.
126    */
127   protected void printResponse(final String methodName, final String finalUrl, final Response response,
128                                final long duration) {
129      step("Response with status: {} received from endpoint: {}-{} in {}ms.",
130            response.getStatusCode(), methodName, finalUrl, duration);
131
132      if (response.body() != null) {
133         String bodyStr = response.body().asPrettyString();
134         if (getApiConfig().logFullBody()) {
135            extended(LOG_TEMPLATE_RESPONSE_BODY, bodyStr);
136         } else {
137            int limit = Math.min(bodyStr.length(), getApiConfig().shortenBody());
138            extended(LOG_TEMPLATE_RESPONSE_BODY, bodyStr.substring(0, limit) + (bodyStr.length() > limit ? "..." : ""));
139         }
140      } else {
141         extended(LOG_TEMPLATE_RESPONSE_BODY, "");
142      }
143
144      extended("Response headers: {}.", response.getHeaders() != null ? response.getHeaders().toString() : "");
145   }
146
147   /**
148    * Attempts to pretty-print JSON request bodies.
149    *
150    * @param content The raw JSON string.
151    * @return The formatted JSON string if valid, otherwise returns the original content.
152    */
153   protected String tryPrettyPrintJson(String content) {
154      if (content == null || content.trim().isEmpty()) {
155         return content;
156      }
157      try {
158         return new JsonPath(content).prettify();
159      } catch (Exception e) {
160         return content;
161      }
162   }
163
164}
